description: TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE BY WHICH THE BILL S. 21, CEDING THE PUBLIC LANDS TO THE NEW STATES WITHIN WHICH SAID LANDS ARE SITUATED, WAS REFFERED TO THE COMM. ON PUBLIC LANDS.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION TO OPPOSE THE PROPOSAL THAT THE CONGRESS OF THE U.S. ASSUME OR GUARANTEE, OR PROVIDE FOR THE ULTIMATE PAYMENT OF STATE DEBTS CONTRACTED FOR LOCAL AND STATE PURPOSES.
TO ADJOURN UNTIL MONDAY NEXT, WHEN THE SENATE ADJOURNS TODAY.
TO POSTPONE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF S. 127 (APP. JULY 4, 1840), A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR THE COLLECTION, SAFE KEEPING, TRANSFER, AND DISBURSEMENT OF THE PUBLIC REVENUE, UNTIL NEXT MONDAY WEEK.
TO AMEND S. 127 BY INCREASING THE SALARY OF THE RECEIVER AT NEW YORK FROM $3000 TO $4000 PER ANNUM.
TO AMEND S. 127 BY INCREASING SALARIES OF RECEIVERS AT ALL PORTS, OTHER THAN NEW YORK, FROM $2500 TO $3000 PER ANNUM.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF MATTHEW BIRCHARD, AS SOLICITOR OF THE TREASURY.
TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT TO S. 127 SO AS TO PAY THE TREASURER OF THE BRANCH MINT AT NEW ORLEANS $2000 PER ANNUM ADDITIONAL TO HIS PRESENT SALARY.
TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 127, SO AS TO ALLOW THE TREASURER AT THE BRANCH MINT AT NEW ORLEANS $1000 EXTRA FOR ADDITIONAL DUTIES PERFORMED BY HIM.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE ON AN AMENDMENT TO S. 127 WHICH INCREASED THE ANNUAL SALARY, OF THE RECEIVER AT NEW YORK, FROM $3000 TO $4000.

TO AMEND S. 127 SO AS TO PROHIBIT THE USE OF NOTES, BILLS, AND PAPER ISSUED UNDER THE AUTHORITY OF THE U.S. LAW, IN PAYMENT OF PUBLIC DUES, IN PAYMENT OF DUTIES, TAXES, SALES OF PUBLIC LANDS, DEBTS, AND SUMS OF MONEY DUE THE U.S. GOVERNMENT.

TO AMEND S. 127 SO AS TO DIRECT THE DISTRICT ATTORNEY OR MARSHALL OF ANY SAID DISTRICT TO EXAMINE THE BOOKS OF THE OFFICERS OF THAT DISTRICT AT LEAST ONCE A YEAR, OR WHEN THE MONEY IN THE HANDS OF THE OFFICERS EXCEEDS THREE-FOURTHS OF HIS OFFICIAL BOND, R AS FREQUENTLY AS THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY MAY DIRECT.
TO AMEND S. 127, SO AS TO STIPULATE UNDER WHAT CIRCUMSTANCES AND IN WHAT MANNER OFFICERS AND AGENTS OF THE U.S. MAY DRAW DRAFTS.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 127.
TO PASS THE BILL S. 120, TO PROVIDE FOR THE ARMED OCCUPATION AND SETTLEMENT OF THAT PART OF FLORIDA WHICH IS NOW OVERRUN AND INFESTED BY MARAUDING BANDS OF HOSTILE INDIANS.
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF S. 127.
TO ADJOURN, MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF S. 127.
TO PASS S. 127.
TO AMEND THE BILL S. 14, TO ESTABLISH A BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS TO HEAR AND EXAMINE CLAIMS AGAINST THE U.S., BY EXCLUDING PRIVATE LAND CLAIMS FROM THE JURISDICTION OF THE BILL.
TO AMEND THE 1ST CLAUSE OF S. 14, SO AS TO MAKE ACTION OF THE BOARD FINAL, WHEN ADVERSE TO CLAIMANTS, BUT NOT SO WHEN AGAINST THE U.S.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND 3RD READING OF S. 14.
TO POSTPONE THE ORDERS OF THE DAY IN ORDER TO CONSIDER THE BILL S. 159, FOR THE CONTINUATION OF THE CUMBERLAND ROAD IN THE STATES OF OHIO, INDIANA AND ILLINOIS.

TO TABLE A MOTION TO PRINT THE REPORT OF THE SELECT COMM. ON THE RESOLUTION OPPOSING THE PROPOSAL THAT THE CONGRESS OF THE U.S. ASSUME, OR GUARANTEE, OR PROVIDE FOR THE ULTIMATE PAYMENT OF STATE DEBTS, CONTRACTED FOR LOCAL AND STATE PURPOSES.

TO PRINT THE REPORT OF THE SELECT COMMITTEE ON THE RESOLUTION TO OPPOSE THE PROPOSAL THAT THE CONGRESS OF THE U.S. ASSUME, OR GUARANTEE, OR PROVIDE FOR THE ULTIMATE PAYMENT OF STATE DEBTS CONTRACTED FOR LOCAL AND STATE PURPOSES.
TO AMEND THE MOTION TO PRINT THE REPORT OF THE SELECT COM- MITTEE ON THE QUESTION OF ASSUMPTION OF STATE DEBTS, BY PRO- VIDING TO PRINT 30,000 ADDITIONAL COPIES OF THE REPORT.

TO PASS THE RESOLUTION, THAT THE COMM. ON PUBLIC LANDS, BE INSTRUCTED TO INQUIRE INTO THE EXPEDIENCY OF ESTABLISHING A HIGHER MINIMUM PRICE FOR THE LANDS CONTAINED IN THE MIAMI RESERVE, SITUATED IN THE STATE OF INDIANA.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION DIRECTING THE SEC. OF THE TREASURY TO INFORM THE SENATE WHAT PROGRESS HAD BEEN MADE IN THE CONSTRUCTION AND CONTINUATION OF THE CUMBERLAND ROAD.

TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION, AND PROPOSED AMENDMENT, TO DIRECT THE SEC. OF TREASURY TO INFORM THE SENATE WHETHER HE PROPOSED AN APPROPRIATION FOR THE CONSTRUCTION AND CON- TINUATION OF THE CUMBERLAND ROAD, AND IF NOT, WHETHER THE OMMISSION WAS UNINTENTIONAL R DESIGNED

TO POSTPONE THE RESOLUTION DIRECTING THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO INFORM THE SENATE, WHETHER HE PROPOSED IN HIS REPORT, AN APPROPRIATION FOR THE CONSTRUCTION AND CONTINUA- TION OF CUMBERLAND ROAD, AND IF NOT, WHETHRT OMISSION WAS UNINTENTIONAL OR DESGNED.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION, THAT THE PRESIDENT BE REQUESTED TO INFORM THE SENATE WHETHER IN THE ANNUAL REPORT OF THE SEC. OF TREASURY, HE PROPOSED ANY APPROPRIATION FOR THE CONSTRUCTION AND CONTINUATION OF THE CUMBERLAND ROAD SO AS TO ELIMINATE FROM RESOLUTON- "AND IF NOT, WHETHER THE OMISSION WAS UNINTENTIONAL OR DESIGNED BY SEC

TO PASS THE RESOLUTION AS AMENDED, THAT THE PRESIDENT BE REQUESTED TO INFORM THE SENATE IF IN THE ANNUAL REPORT OF THE SEC. OF TREASURY, HE PROPOSED ANY APPROPRIATION FOR THE CONSTRUCTION AND CONTINUATION OF THE CUMBERLAND ROAD.

TO REFER TO THE COMM. ON THE JUDICIARY, A MEMORIAL FROM INHABITANTS OF THE TERRITORY OF FLORIDA, SEEKING ADMISSION INTO THE UNION AS A STATE, (RATHER THAN REFERRING THEM TO A SELECT COMMITTEE APPOINTED BY THE VICE PRESIDENT).
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF JOSHUA VANSANT AS POSTMASTER AT BALTIMORE, MARYLAND.

TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION OF THE SELECT COMMITTEE, WHICH RESOLUTION OPPOSE THE ASSUMPTION OF THE STATE DEBTS, AND THE DISTRIBUTION OF THE PROCEEDS OF PUBLIC LAND SALES AMONG THE SEVERAL STATES.
TO RECOMMIT THE REPORT ON THE BILL S. 298, FOR THE RELIEF OF JUBAL B. HANCOCK, TO THE COMM. ON INDIAN AFFAIRS WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT THE BILL IN FAVOR OF THE PETITIONER.

TO CONCUR IN HOUSE AMENDMENT TO S. 154 (APP. FEB. 26, 1840, 5 STAT 365), A BILL TO AMEND AN ACT TO PROVIDE FOR TAKING THE SIXTH CENSUS OF THE INHABITANTS OF THE U.S., APPROVED MAR. 3, 1839, WHICH AMENDMENT REDUCES THE SALARY OF THE CLERK ON THE CENSUS FRM $2000 TO $1500.

TO TABLE THE WHOLE SUBJECT OF ALLOWING A DEBENTURE ON FOREIGN COAL CONSUMED IN STEAM PACKETS.  THE COMMITTEE PROPOSED A RESOLUTION THAT NO FURTHER LEGISLATION ON THE MATTER IS NECESSARY, REGARDING THE MEMORIAL OF THE WESTERN STEAMSHIP CO. OF BRISTOL, ENGAND, AND OTHERS.

TO CONCUR IN THE HOUSE AMENDMENT TO THE BILL S. 179, (APP. MAR. 4, 1840, 5 STAT L 369), TO CONTINUE THE OFFICE OF COMMISSIONER OF PENSIONS, AND TO TRANSFER THE PENSION BUSINESS PREVIOUSLY TRANSACTED IN THE NAVY DEPARTMENT TO THAT OFFICE; THE AMENDMENT BENG TO REDUCE THE SALARY OF THE COMMISSIONERS OF PENSIONS.

TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION THAT THE 47TH RULE BE AMENDED TO READ-- "TWO REPORTERS BE ALLOWED FOR EACH OF THE DAILY PAPERS, AND ONE REPORTER FOR EACH TRI-WEEKLY PAPER, PRINTED AND PUBLISHED IN THE CITY OF WASH., WHOSE NAMES SHALL BE COMMUNICATED IN WRITING, Y THE EDITORS OF THOSE PAPERS, TO SEC

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION TO ADMIT REPORTERS TO THE SENATE UNDER CERTAIN RESTRICTIONS AND CONDITIONS AS SET FORTH IN THE RESOLUTION, SO AS TO HAVE THE 47TH RULE APPLY TO THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, NOT THE CITY OF WASHINGTON.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO AMEND THE 47TH RULE TO ADMIT A CERTAIN NUMBER OF REPORTERS UNDER CERTAIN CONDITIONS AND RESTRICTIONS.

TO AMEND MR. BUCHANAN'S AMENDMENT TO THE RESOLUTIONS OF THE SELECT COMMITTEE ON THE SUBJECT OF ASSUMPTION OF STATE DEBTS, WHICH RESOLUTIONS OPPOSE ASSUMPTION OF SAID DEBTS, AND THE SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS FOR THIS PURPOSE. MR. BUCHANAN'S AMENDMENT IS TO ADDAN ADDITIONAL RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT THE DEBTS OF THE SEVERAL STATES, SO FAR AS THEY ARE KNOWN TO THE SENATE, HAVE BEEN CONTRACTED IN THE EXERCISE OF THE UNDOUBTED RIGHT AND CONSTITUTIONAL POWER OF SAID STATES RESPECTIVELY, AND THAT THERE IS NO GROUND ...

TO STRIKE OUT ALL OF THE RESOLUTIONS SUBMITTED BY THE COMMITTEE, WHICH RESOLUTIONS OPPOSE THE ASSUMPTION OF STATE DEBTS AND THE SALE OF PUBLIC LANDS, AND TO INSERT A RESOLU- TION THAT THE DEBTS OF THE SEFERAL STATES HAVE BEEN LEGITIMATELY CONTRACTED AND HAT THERE IS NO DOUBT OF THEIR DISPOSITION AND ABILITY TO PAY, AND FURTHER RESOLVING THAT IT WOULD BE PROPER AND DESIREABLE TO DISTRIBUTE THE PROCEEDS OF THE SALES OF THE PUBLIC LANDS AMONG THE SEVERAL STATES, IN FAIR AND RATABLE PROPORTIONS.

TO AMEND THE FIRST RESOLUTION OF THE SELECT COMMITTEE WHICH RESOLUTION IS THAT THE ASSUMPTION, DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY, BY THE GENERAL GOVERNMENT, OF THE DEBTS WHICH HAVE BEEN OR MAY BE, CONTRACTED BY THE STATES FOR LOCAL OBJECTS OR STATE PURPOSES, WOULD E UNJUST, BOTH TO THE STATES AND TO THE PEOPLE
TO PASS THE FIRST RESOLUTION THAT THE ASSUMPTION OF THE DEBTS OF THE STATES WOULD BE UNJUST TO BOTH THE STATES AND THE PEOPLE.
TO ADOPT THE SECOND RESOLUTION OF THE SELECT COMMITTEE, WHICH PROVIDES THAT THE ASSUMPTION OF STATE DEBTS WOULD BE HIGHLY INEXPEDIENT, AND DANGEROUS TO THE UNION OF THE STATES.

TO ADOPT THE THIRD RESOLUTION ON ASSUMPTION OF STATE DEBTS, WHICH IS THAT SUCH ASSUMPTION WOULD BE WHOLLY UNAUTHORIZED BY, THE CONSTITUTION OF THE U.S., AND UTTERLY REPUGNANT TO ALL THE OBJECTS AND PURPOSES FOR WHICH THE FEDERAL UNION WAS FORMED.

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTIONS, REGARDING ASSUMPTION OF STATE DEBTS, BY ADDING A PROVISION THAT THE RESOLUTIONS, SHALL NOT BE CONSIDERED AS DENYING CONGRESS THE RIGHT TO MAKE AN EQUAL DISTRIBUTION OF THE PROCEEDS OF PUBLIC BONDS, AMONG THE STATES ACCORDING TO ERMS AND THE DEEDS OF SESSION

TO AMEND THE 4TH RESOLUTION, THAT TO SET APART THE PUBLIC LANDS, OR THE REVENUES ARISING THEREFROM FOR THE BEFORE MENTIONED PURPOSES, WOULD BE EQUALLY UNJUST, INEXPEDIENT AND UNCONSTITUTIONAL; SO AS TO LEAVE NO DOUBT THAT THE STATES ARE WITHIN THEIR CONSITUTIONAL RIGHTS TO CONTRACT DEBTS.
TO PRINT TEN THOUSAND ADDITIONAL COPIES FOR THE USE OF THE SENATE OF THE DOCUMENTS REPORTED FROM THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE ON THE SUBJECT OF SALT.

TO POSTPONE UNTIL MONDAY NEXT, FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF THE RESOLUTION S.R. 4, THAT THE PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE AND THE SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES ADJOURN THEIR RESPECTIVE HOUSES SINE DIE ON MONDAY, THE NEXT DAY OF MAY NEXT, TO PREVENT FIXIN A DATE FOR SINE DIE ADJOURNMENT UNTIL PUBLIC BUSINESS IS DISPOSED OF.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION S.R. 4, THAT THE PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE AND THE SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE OF REP. ADJOURN THEIR RESPECTIVE HOUSES, "SINE DIE" ON MONDAY, THE NEXT DAY OF MAY NEXT.
TO CONSENT TO THE NOMINATION OF HENRY LEDYARD AS SECRETARY TO THE LEGATION AT PARIS.

TO POSTPONE THE RESOLUTION S.R. 4, UNTIL MARCH 30, PROVIDING THAT THE PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE AND THE SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE OF REP. DO ADJOURN THEIR RESPECTIVE HOUSES SINE DIE ON MONDAY, THE DAY OF MAY NEXT.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE CONVENTION FOR THE ADJUSTMENT OF CLAIMS OF CITIZENS OF THE U.S. UPON THE GOVERNMENT OF THE MEXICAN REPUBLIC, DONE AT THE CITY OF WASHINGTON ON MARCH 11, 1839.
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION UNTIL MONDAY NEXT OF THE BILL S. 159, FOR THE CONTINUATION OF THE CUMBERLAND ROAD IN THE STATES OF OHIO, INDIANA AND ILLINOIS.
TO POSTPONE FURTHER CONSIDERATION OF S. 159, UNTIL THURSDAY NEXT.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 15, A BILL GRANTING A PENSION TO LEMUEL WHITE.

TO RECOMMIT THE BILL S. 110, TO PROVIDE FOR THE PAYMENT OF DAMAGES SUSTAINED BY INDIVIDUALS IN WARS WITH INDIAN TRIBES SINCE 1830, TO THE COMMITTEE ON CLAIMS, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO STRIKE OUT THE CLAUSE REQUIRING THE THIRD AUDITOR TO REPORT CLAIMS TO CONGESS BEFORE SETTLEMENT.
TO AMEND S. 159 TO PROVIDE THAT CERTAIN SPECIFIC SUMS BE APPROPRIATED FOR THE MILITARY AND GEOGRAPHICAL SURVEY OF THE COUNTRY WEST OF THE MISSISSIPPI.

TO RECOMMIT THE BILL S. 3, TO MORE EFFECTUALLY SECURE PUBLIC MONEY IN THE HANDS OF OFFICERS AND AGENTS OF THE GOVERNMENT, AND TO PUNISH PUBLIC DEFAULTERS, TO THE COMMITTEE ON FINANCE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT BACK THE BILL WITH AMENDMENTS AS SPECIFIED.
TO BRING UP FOR FINAL PASSAGE, THE BILL H.R. 18, ADDITIONAL TO THE ACT ON THE SUBJECT OF TREASURY NOTES.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION S.R. 4, THAT THE PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE AND THE SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE OF REP. ADJOURN THEIR RESPECTIVE HOUSES, SINE DIE ON MONDAY THE 18 DAY OF MAY NEXT.

TO AMEND S. 159 BY ELIMINATING THE PROVISION THAT SUMS APPROPRIATED FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE ROAD, SHALL BE REPLACED BY THE STATES OF OHIO, ILLINOIS, AND INDIANA, OUT OF THE FUNDS APPROPRIATED TO THEM BY CONGRESS, FOR FOR ROAD CONSTRUCTION.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND 3RD READING OF THE BILL S. 90, TO RELINQUISH THE REVISIONARY INTEREST OF THE U.S. TO A CERTAIN RESERVATION IN THE STATE OF ALABAMA.

TO AMEND S. 159 SO THAT 2% OF THE NET PROCEEDS OF THE SALES OF PUBLIC LANDS IN THE STATES OF INDIANA, ILLINOIS, AND OHIO, BE RELINQUISHED TO THE SAID STATES FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF ROADS AND CANALS, WITHIN THEIR STATES, AS THEY THINK PROPER, PROVIDED THELEGISLATURES OF EACH STATE PASS LEGISLATION ASSENTING TO THE PROVISIONS OF THIS ACT.
TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 159, SO AS TO FURTHER REDUCE THE APPROPRIATION FOR THE STATES OF OHIO, IND. AND ILL.

TO AMEND THE BILL, S. 92 (APP. JUNE 12, 1840) FOR THE DISCONTINUANCE OF THE OFFICE OF SURVEYOR GENERAL IN THE SEVERAL DISTRICTS, SO SOON AS THE SURVEYS THEREIN CAN BE COMPLETED, AND FOR ABOLISHING LAND OFFICES UNDER CERTAIN CIRCUMSTANCES, THE SAID AMENDMNT ABOLISHING THE OFFICE OF THE GENERAL LAND OFFICE.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND 3RD READING OF S. 159.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO PROVIDE THAT THE PRESIDENT BE REQUESTED TO CAUSE TO BE LAID BEFORE THE SENATE OF THE WHOLE OF THE PROCEEDINGS OF A COURT MARTIAL RECENTLY ASSEMBLED AT CHARLESTOWN, MASS., FOR THE TRIAL OF 2ND LEIUTENANT LOUIS F. WHITNEY, OF THEMARINE CORPS.

TO AMEND THE BILL S. 139, TO REVIVE AN ACT ENTITLED, AN ACT TO ENABLE CLAIMANTS OF LAND WITHIN THE LIMITS OF WISCONSIN, MISSOURI AND THE TERRITORY OF ARK. TO INSTITUTE PROCEEDINGS TO TRY THE VALIDITY OF THEIR CLAIMS (APP. MAY 26, 1824) AND AN ACT AMENDIN SAME, AND EXTENDING THE PROVISIONS TO CLAIMANTS WITHIN THE STATES OF LOUISIANA, AND MISS., BY PROVIDING THAT THIS SHALL NOT APPLY TO ANY CLAIM IN THE STATE OF MISSOURI FOR MORE THAN 20,000 ACRES.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND 3RD READING OF THE BILL S. 139, TO REVIVE AN ACT TO ENABLE CLAIMANTS OF LAND IN WISCONSIN, MISSOURI AND THE TERRITORY OF ARKANSAS TO INSTITUTE PROCEEDINGS TO TRY THE VALIDITY OF THEIR CLAIMS, (APP. MAY 26, 1824) AN ACT AMENDING SME, AND EXTENDING THE PROVISIONS TO CLAIMANTS WITHIN THE STATES OF LOUISIANA AND MISSISSIPPI.

TO TABLE THE RESOLUTIONS: (1) THAT A VESSEL ON HIGH SEAS IN TIME OF PEACE, ENGAGED IN LAWFUL VOYAGE, IS, ACCORDING TO LAW OF NATIONS, UNDER SOLE JURISDICTION OF STATE TO WHICH HER FLAG BELONGS, (2) THAT IF SUCH VESSEL IS FORCED, BY UNA- VOIDABLE CAUSE INO THE PORT OF A FRIENDLY POWER, SHE WOULD LOSE NONE OF THE RIGHTS OF THE HIGH SEAS, (3) THAT THE BRIG ENTERPRISE, WHICH WAS FORCED UNAVOIDABLY INTO PORT IN HAMILTON, BERMUDA ISLAND, COMES WITHIN THE PRINCIPALS EMBRACED IN FOREGOING RESOLUTIONS, AND THAT T...

TO PASS THE RESOLUTIONS PROTESTING THE SEIZURE OF THE NEGROES ON BOARD THE BRIG ENTERPRISE BY THE AUTHORITIES OF THE BERMUDA ISLAND.  THE RESOLUTIONS MAINTAIN THAT THE SEIZURE WAS AN ACT IN VIOLATION OF THE LAWS OF NATIONS AND HIGHLY UNJUST TO OUR CITIZES TO WHOM THE NEGROES BELONG.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO THE BILL S. 12 (APP. JUNE 1, 1840) SUPPLEMENTING AN ACT TO GRANT PRE-EMPTION RIGHTS TO SETTLERS ON PUBLIC LANDS, BY MAKING FOUR MONTHS OCCUPANCY PREVIOUS TO PASSAGE OF BILL A CONDITION FOR PRE-EMPTION.
TO AMEND S. 12 SO AS TO EXTEND THE PRE-EMPTION ACT OF JUNE 22, 1838 TO JUNE 22, 1842.
TO AMEND S. 12 BY ELIMINATING 2ND SECTION OF BILL WHICH WOULD GIVE RIGHT OF PRE-EMPTION TO INHABITANTS OF LAND, WHO MIGHT NOT NECESSARILY BE ORIGINAL SETTLERS.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND 3RD READING OF S. 12.

TO RECOMMIT THE BILL S. 114, SUPPLEMENTING AN ACT TO ESTABLISH BRANCHES OF THE U.S. MINT, TO THE COMM. ON FINANCE, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO INQUIRE INTO THE EXPEDIENCY OF ABOLISHING OR SUSPENDING THE VARIOUS BRANCH MINTS.

TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY THE BILL S. 188 FOR THE RELIEF OF THE VESTRY AND CHURCHWARDENS OF THE PROTESTANT EPISCOPAL CHURCH OF THE PARISH OF ST. PHILIP, IN CITY OF CHARLESTON, S.C., (GRANTING PERMISSION TO IMPORT AN ORGAN DUTY FREE).
TO ADJOURN.
TO ADJOURN.

TO PASS THE BILL S. 188 FOR THE RELIEF OF THE VESTRY AND CHURCH WARDENS OF THE PROTESTANT EPISCOPAL CHURCH OF THE PARISH OF ST. PHILIP, IN THE CITY OF CHARLESTON, IN THE STATE OF S. CAROLINA (GRANTING PERMISSION TO IMPORT AN ORGAN DUTY FREE).

TO RECOMMIT THE BILL S. 12 TO THE COMM. ON PUBLIC LANDS WITH INSTRUCTIONS, FIRST: TO RESTRICT THE RIGHT OF PRE-EMPTION TO CITIZENS OF THE U.S., SECOND: TO ELIMINATE THE SECTION RECOGNISING THE PRINCIPLE THAT THE PUBLIC LAND, PRIOR TO THE GRANT OF PRE-EMPION, OR ANY OTHER GRANT, CAN BE THE SUBJECT OF CREATING THE RELATION OF LESSOR AND LESSEE, THIRD: TO ELIMINATE THE SECTION REVIVING THE RIGHT TO FLOATS.
TO PASS S. 12.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND 3RD READING OF THE BILL S. 124, FOR SETTLEMENT OF CLAIM OF AVERY SALTMARSH AND COMPANY FOR LOSSES SUSTAINED IN EXECUTION OF MAIL CONTRACTS, FOR LOSSES OF HORSES, SUPPLIES, AND EQUIPMENT DESTROYED BY THE CREEK INDIANS, DURING LATEHOSTILITIES WITH SAME.
TO TABLE THE BILL S. 124, FOR SETTLEMENT OF THE CLAIM OF AVERY SALTMARSH AND CO. ON ACCOUNT OF LOSSES SUSTAINED IN EXECUTION OF MAIL CONTRACTS.

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT TO THE BILL S. 10, PROVIDING FOR THE REDUCTION AND GRADUATION OF THE PIECE OF PUBLIC LANDS, BY ELIMINATING SECTIONS 3 AND 4 WHICH OUTLINE CONDITIONS AND PROCEDURES FOR OBTAINING PUBLIC LANDS AT REDUCED RATES.
TO AMEND S. 10, BY ELIMINATING FROM SECTION 2 THE PROVISION WHICH CONFINED THE PRIVILEGES OF PURCHASING LANDS AT A LESS PRICE TO SETTLERS ON ADJACENT LANDS.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND 3RD READING OF S. 10.
TO PASS S. 10.
TO POSTPONE, INDEFINITELY, THE BILL H.R. 44 FOR THE RELIEF OF THOMAS FILLEBROWN JR.

TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION CALLING ON THE SEC. OF THE TREASURY FOR INFORMATION AS TO THE NAMES AND NUMBER OF BANKS IN WHICH SPECIAL DEPOSITS WERE MADE, IN CERTIFICATION OF TREASURY NOTES, ON THE GROUND THAT INFORMATION HAD BEEN PREVIOUSLY FURNISHED.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND 3RD READING OF THE BILL S. 111, GRANTING TO THE STATE OF MICHIGAN, A QUANTITY OF LAND TO AID SAID STATE IN THE CONSTRUCTION OF A CANAL AROUND THE FALLS OF ST. MARIE.

TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND 3RD READING OF THE BILL S. 22, TO AUTHORIZE THE NEW ALBANY AND MOUNT CARMEL R.R. CO. TO ENTER, ON A CREDIT, A QUANTITY OF LAND TO AID THE COMPANY IN THE CONSTRUCTION OF A RAILROAD FROM NEW ALBANY, IND., TO MOUNT CARMEL, ILLINOIS.

TO AMEND THE BILL H.R. 8 (APP. MAY 2, 1840), MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE CIVIL AND DIPLOMATIC EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR THE YEAR 1840, BY ELIMINATING THE APPROPRIA- TION OF $45,000 FOR THE 2ND AND 3RD VOLUMES OF THE DOCUMENTARY HISTORY OF THE AMERCAN REVOLUTION.
TO PASS THE BILL H.R. 8 (APP. MAY 2, 1840), MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE CIVIL AND DIPLOMATIC EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR THE YEAR 1840.
TO ADJOURN; THE VICE PRESIDENT VOTING IN THE NEGATIVE.
TO CONSIDER THE RESOLUTION DIRECTING THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO PROVIDE THE SENATE WITH REPORT OF HIS EXPENSES, AND PROVIDING TO PRINT 30,000 COPIES OF THE REPORT.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND 3RD READING OF THE BILL S. 118, GRANTING A PENSION TO THE HAMAH LEIGHTON.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO CHANGE THE HOUR OF MEETING FROM 12 NOON TO 11 A.M.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE ARTICLES OF A TREATY MADE AT STOCKBRIDGE IN THE TERRITORY OF WISCONSIN IN AUG. OF 1839, BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE STOCKBRIDGE AND MUNSEE TRIBES OF INDIANS.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY THE BILL S. 142, FOR THE RELIEF OF WILLIAM BENNETT.
TO PASS THE BILL S. 185, TO CREATE AN ADDITIONAL LAND OFFICE IN THE STATE OF MICHIGAN.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY THE BILL S. 33, FOR THE RELIEF OF RICHARD ROBERTSON.
TO POSTPONE, INDEFINITELY, CONSIDERATION OF THE REPORT FROM THE COMM. ON CLAIMS CONCERNING THE PETITION FOR THE RELIEF OF WILLIAM AND JAMES CROOK.
TO ADJOURN.
TO CHANGE THE DAILY HOUR OF MEETING FOR THE SENATE TO 12 NOON.

TO AMEND THE BILL S. 352, MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE PATENT OFFICE FOR THE YEAR 1840, BY ELIMINATING, APPROPRIATIONS OF $1,000 FOR COLLECTING AGRICULTURAL STATISTICS, AND FOR OTHER AGRICULTURAL PURPOSES.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY TO BILL S. 217, FOR THE RELIEF OF JOSEPH ROBY.
TO PASS THE BILL S. 222, TO CONVEY PROPERTY TO THE VALUES OF $5,000 FOR THE USE OF HOWARD INSTITUTION OF THE CITY OF WASHINGTON.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO THE BILL S. 324, TO ESTABLISH A UNIFORM SYSTEM OF BANKRUPTCY THROUGHOUT THE U.S.; WHICH AMENDMENT RESTRICTED IT TO PERSONS ENGAGED IN BUYING AND SELLING, INSTEAD OF TRADING, BY REMOVING THOSE RESTRICTIONS, AND MAKING IT GENERAL I ITS APPLICATION.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY THE BILL S. 112, FOR THE RELIEF OF THE LEGAL REPRESENTATIVES OF PHILIP BARBOR, DECEASED.

TO AMEND S. 324 BY ELIMINATING FROM SECTION 14, THE FOLLOWING WORDS, "AND IN MAKING SUCH DIVIDENDS, THE SAID ASSIGNEES SHALL FIRST PAY ALL DEBTS, THAT MAY BE DUE BY SUCH BANKRUPT AS EXECUTOR, ADMINISTRATOR, GUARDIAN, AND IF THERE BE NOT SUFFICIENT TO PAYALL DEBTS OF THE CHARACTER LAST SPECIFIED, THEN A DISTRIBUTION SHALL BE MADE AMONG THEM, IN PROPORTION TO THEIR AMOUNTS RESPECTIVELY."

TO AMEND S. 324, BY ELIMINATING SECTION 9, LINES 53, AS FOLLOWS: "AND THAT NO PERSON SHALL BE ENTITLED TO SUCH DECREE OF DISCHARGE AND CERTIFICATE, IF IT BE MADE TO APPEAR TO THE SAID COURT, ON OR BEFORE GRANTING THE SAME, THAT HE HATH LOST, WITHIN ONE YAR BEFORE PRESENTING HIS PETITION, BY ANY GAMING, WAGERING, OR BETTING OF ANY KIND, AT ANY ONE TIME, A ------- SUM OF DOLLARS."

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 324 SO AS TO ELIMINATE THE FOL- LOWING WORDS, "AND ALL PERSONS, CORPORATIONS, OR ASSOCIA- TIONS OF PERSONS WHO SHALL ISSUE, PAY OUT, OR OMIT BILLS, DRAFTS, OR OBLIGATIONS, WITH THE DESIGN THAT THEY SHALL CIRCULATE INSTEAD OF, R AS A SUBSTITUTE FOR MONEY."
TO CONSIDER EXECUTIVE BUSINESS.
TO ADJOURN UNTIL MONDAY NEXT, WHEN THE SENATE ADJOURNS TODAY.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY CONSIDERATION OF S. 324.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL S. 112, FOR THE RELIEF OF THE LEGAL REPRESENTATIVES OF PHILIP BARBOUR, DECEASED; CHAIR VOTING IN THE AFFIRMATIVE.

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 324, SO AS TO ELIMINATE THE PROVISION IN THE AMENDMENT THAT ALL PERSONS RESIDING IN THE U.S., BEING MERCHANTS SEEKING THEIR LIVING BY BUYING AND SELLING, OWING DEBTS IN THE WHOLE AMOUNTING TO A SPECIFIED SUM, SHALL BE LIABLE T BECOME BANKRUPT IN TRUE INTENT AND MEANING OF THIS ACT.
TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY CONSIDERATION OF S. 324.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE ARTICLES OF A TREATY MADE AND CONCLUDED ON THE PART OF THE U.S. AND THE SHAWANOES INDIANS IN DECEMBER OF 1839.
TO PASS THE BILL S. 112, FOR THE RELIEF OF THE LEGAL REPRESENTATIVES OF PHILIP BARBOUR, DECEASED.
TO AMEND THE BILL H.R. 265, FOR THE RELIEF OF GENERAL DUNCAN L. CLINCH, TO CLARIFY THE CIRCUMSTANCES UNDER WHICH RELIEF IS DUE IS THIS CASE.

TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT TO THE BILL S. 92 (APP. TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT, IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO S. 299, WHICH SUBSTITUTE, WOULD CONTINUE THE CHARTER OF THE FARMERS BANK OF GEORGETOWN, BANK OF METROPOLIS, PATRIOTIC BANK, OF WASHINGTON, AND FARMERS BANK OF ALEXANDRIA, AND BANK OF THE POTOMAC TOJULY 4, 1841; THE PROPOSED AMENDMENT THERETO WOULD CONTINUE THE CHARTER TO 1842.

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT, IN NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE, FOR THE BILL S. 299, INCORPORATING THE SEVERAL BANKS OF THE DISTRICT COLUMBIA; WHICH SUBSTITUTE WOULD CONTINUE THE CHARTER OF THE FARMERS BANK OF GEORGETOWN, BANK OF METROPOLIS, PATRIOTIC BANK OF WASHINGON, AND FARMERS BANK OF ALEXANDRIA AND BANK OF THE POTOMAC, TO 1842; THE AMENDMENT THERETO PROVIDING THAT SAID BANKS AT THIS TIME ARE NON- SPECIE PAYING BANKS.

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT IN NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR S. 299 WHICH SUBSTITUTE WOULD CONTINUE THE CHARTER OF THE FARMERS BANK OF GEORGETOWN, BANK OF METROPOLIS, PATRIOTIC BANK OF WASHINTON, AND THE FARMERS BANK OF ALEXANDRIA, AND BANK OF THE POTOMAC, TO 182, AND THAT SAID BANKS, AT THIS TIME ARE NON-SPECIE PAYING BANKS, BY PROVIDING, THAT NOTES OF ANY OTHER BANK, BANKER, BANKING, INSTITUTIONS OR CORPORATION, WHICH IS IN A STATE OF SUSPENSION OR NON-PAYMENT OF ITS LIABILITIES IN SPECIE, SHALL NOT BE HONORED...

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR S. 299, WHICH SUBSTITUTE WOULD CONTINUE THE CHARTER OF THE FARMERS BANK OF GEORGETOWN, BANK OF METROPOLIS, PATRIOTIC BANK OF WASHINGTON, AND FARMERS BANK OF ALEXANDRIA, AND THE BANK OF THE POTOMAC,TO 1842, AND STATING THAT SAID BANKS AT THIS TIME ARE NON-SPECIE PAYING BANKS, THE AMENDMENT THERETO WOULD REQUIRE AN AFFIDAVIT OF MERIT TO BE MADE BY ANY BANK REQUESTING A STAY OF EXECUTION ON A JUDGEMENT MADE AGAINST IT.

TO AMEND AMENDMENT, IN NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE, TO S. 299, WHICH SUBSTITUTE, IS TO CONTINUE, THE CHARTER OF THE FARMERS BANK OF WASHINGTON, AND FARMERS BANK OF ALEXANDRIA, AND THE BANK OF THE POTOMAC, TO 1842, AND STATING THAT SAID BANKS AT THIS TIME ARE ON-SPECIE PAYING BANK; BY PROVIDING THAT CERTIFIED BANKS PAY IN GOLD AND SILVER COIN, OTHERWISE ITS CHARTER IS TO BE NULL AND VOID.
TO AGREE TO ADOPT THE AMENDMENT AS AMENDED TO S. 299.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 299.

TO ORDER PRINTING OF THE REPLY FROM THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OF THE UNION BANK OF FLORIDA, TO THE REPORTS OF THE BANK AND JUDICIARY COMMITTEES OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES OF THE LEGISLATIVE COUNCIL OF FLORIDA.

TO AMEND THE BILL S. 322 TO AUTHORIZE THE ERECTION OF CERTAIN LIGHT HOUSES AND LIGHTBOATS, AND THE ESTABLISHMENT OF CERTAIN BOUYS AND BEACON LIGHTS; BY PROVIDING AN APPROPRIATION FOR CONSTRUCTION OF A LIGHTHOUSE IN THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.

TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY THE BILL S. 22, TO AUTHORIZE THE MOUNT CARMEL AND NEW ALBANY RAILROAD COMPANY TO ENTER ON CREDIT, A QUANTITY OF LAND TO AID THE COMPANY IN THE CONSTRUCTION OF A RAILROAD FROM NEW ALBANY, INDIANA, TO MOUNT CARMEL, ILLINOIS.

TO AMEND BILL S. 85, GIVING THE ASSENT OF CONGRESS TO THE ACTS OF THE GENERAL ASSEMBLY OF VIRGINIA, INCORPORATING THE FALMOUTH AND ALEXANDRIA RAILROAD COMPANY, BY ELIMINATING 3RD SECTION OF BILL, CONTAINING $300,000 APPROPRIATION TO ENABLE SAID COMPANY T CONNECT WITH THE WASHINGTON BRANCH OF THE BALTIMORE AND OHIO RAILROAD.

TO AMEND THE BILL, S. 369, ESTABLISHING A UNIFORM SYSTEM OF BANKRUPTCY THROUGHOUT THE U.S., BY ADDING A PROVISION THAT NOTHING IN THIS ACT SHALL ANNUL, DESTROY, INJURE ANY LAWFUL RIGHTS OF MARRIED WOMEN OR MINORS, OR ANY LIENS, MORTGAGES, OR OTHER SECURIIES ON REAL OR PERSONAL PROPERTY, VALID UNDER STATE LAWS AND NOT INCONSISTENT WITH SECTIONS 2 AND 5 OF THIS ACT.

TO AMEND S. 369 TO PROVIDE THAT IN CASE OF THE DEBTOR BEING ARRESTED OR SURRENDERED, IN THE DISCHARGE OF HIS BAIL, SHALL REMAIN IN PRISON 40 DAYS, OR ESCAPE THERE FROM, OR SHALL NOT, WITHIN 40 DAYS, GIVE THE NECESSARY BAIL OR SECURITY REQUIRED BY LAW, HI CREDITORS MAY BE AUTHORIZED TO PROCEED AGAINST HIM AS A BANKRUPT.

TO AMEND S. 369 TO PROVIDE THAT IN CASE A DEBTOR SHALL FRAUDULENTLY DISPOSE OF ANY OF HIS GOODS OR CHATTELS, OR DECLARE HIMSELF TO BE INSOLVENT OR UNABLE TO PAY HIS DEBTS, THEN THE CREDITORS SHOULD BE AUTHORIZED TO PROCEED AGAINST HIM UNDER THE LAW AS A ANKRUPT.

TO AMEND S. 369 SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT IN CASES WHERE THE BANKRUPTCY IS VOLUNTARY, THE BANKRUPT SHALL NOT BE DISCHARG- ED FROM BANKRUPTCY WITHOUT THE CONSENT OF CREDITORS HOLDING AT LEAST ONE-HALF HIS DEBTS.

TO AMEND S. 369 TO PROVIDE THAT IN A VOLUNTARY BANKRUPTCY, WHERE IT IS MADE TO APPEAR THAT THE BANKRUPT MADE PREFERENCES TO CREDITORS, IN ANTICIPATION OF THE PASSAGE OF THIS ACT, NO DISCHARGE SHALL BE GRANTED, UNLESS, ASSENTED TO BY A MAJORITY, IN INTERET OF THOSE OF HIS CREDITORS WHO HAVE NOT BEEN SO PREFERRED.
TO AMEND S. 369 TO PROVIDE THAT THE ACT IS ONLY TO APPLY TO FUTURE CONTRACTS.
TO RECOMMIT S. 369 WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO ALTER THE BILL SO AS TO VEST APPOINTMENT OF ASSIGNERS SOLELY IN THE CREDITORS AND TO PRESCRIBE MORE PARTICULARLY THE DUTIES OF THE ASSIGNEES.
TO ADJOURN THE SENATE, MOTION MADE DURING CONSIDERATION OF S. 369.
TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT TO S. 369 WHICH WOULD NULLIFY ANY ATTACHMENT OR MESNE PROCESS WHICH SHOULD BE MADE SUBSEQUENT TO THE PASSAGE OF THE BILL AND TO THE DETRIMENT OF A PORTION OF THE CREDITORS.
TO TABLE S. 369.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE ON S. 369, BY WHICH IT WAS DECIDED TO FIX MARCH 4 AS THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF THE ACT.
TO AGREE, ON RECONSIDERATION, TO FIX MARCH 4 AS THE EFFEC- TIVE DATE OF S. 369.
TO AGREE TO FEBRUARY 1 AS THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF S. 369.
TO AMEND S. 369 BY ELIMINATING A CLAUSE LIMITING THE PERIOD OF EFFECTIVENESS OF THE ACT, THUS MAKING IT A PERMANENT ACT.
TO AMEND S. 369 BY REQUIRING NOTICE TO BE GIVEN WHERE PRACTICABLE TO ALL CREDITORS, EITHER PERSONAL OR BY LETTER, OF THE PENDENCY OF BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 369.
TO PASS S. 369.

TO AGREE TO THE AMENDMENT AS AMENDED TO H.R. 100, TO DECLARE ANY WITNESS INCOMPETENT WHO SHOULD HAVE ANY INTEREST WHATEVER IN THE CASE SIMILAR TO THE INTEREST OF THE PARTY, FOR WHOM HE MIGHT BE CALLED TO TESTIFY.
TO AMEND H.R. 100 TO PROVIDE THAT NO MIXED GOODS SHALL BE DESIGNATED AS SILK, UNLESS THE VALUE OF THE SILK IN THE FABRIC EXCEEDS THE VALUE OF ALL THE OTHER MATERIALS.
TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 100, SO AS TO MAKE SEPT. 1ST INSTEAD OF OCT. NEXT THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF THE ACT.

TO AMEND H.R. 100, TO PROVIDE THAT THE BILL IS TO CEASE EFFECTIVENESS AFTER JUNE 30, 1842.

THE VOTE IS TO FURTHER CONSIDER A HOUSE BILL TO REGULATE AND EQUALIZE THE MILEAGE OF MEMBERS OF CONGRESS.

TO ADOPT THE AMENDMENT AS AMENDED TO H.R. 448, BY MAKING THE SHORTEST MAIL ROUTE THE STANDARD OF DISTANCE AND PROVIDING TO PUBLISH THE MILEAGE DISTANCE ALLOWED, THUS MAKING EACH MEMBER RESPONSIBLE FOR THIS TO HIS CONSTITUENTS.
TO AMEND H.R. 448 SO THAT HEREAFTER NO STATIONERY BE ALLOWED TO MEMBERS OF CONGRESS, AND INSTEAD, THERE SHALL BE PAID TO EACH MEMBER THE SUM OF $20.
TO AMEND H.R. 448 TO DEDUCT A MEMBER'S PER DIEM, WHERE HE FAILS TO ANSWER THE ROLLS OF THE YEAS AND NAYS, UNLESS ABSENT BECAUSE OF ILLNESS OR ATTENDANCE UPON A COMMITTEE.
TO AMEND H.R. 448 BY PERMITTING MEMBERS OF CONGRESS TO ENJOY FRANKING PRIVILEGES, FROM A PERIOD, BEGINNING 30 DAYS BEFORE THE SESSION, AND ENDING 30 DAYS AFTER THE SESSION.
TO AMEND H.R. 448 SO AS TO PERMIT THE FRANKING PRIVILEGES ONLY ON PUBLIC DOCUMENTS, WHEN CONGRESS IS NOT IN SESSION.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE CONCURRING IN THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 448, PROVIDING FOR THE FORFIETURE OF PER DIEM PAY OF A MEMBER IN CASE OF ABSENCE FROM ANY ONE ROLL CALL TAKEN ON THAT DAY.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF H.R. 448.

TO RECOMMIT H.R. 448 TO THE JUDICIARY COMMITTEE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT A SUBSTITUTE PROVIDING FOR THE APPOINTMENT, EARLY IN EACH SESSION, OF A JOINT COMMITTEE TO DETERMINE AND REPORT THE MILEAGE OF EACH MEMBER.
TO POSTPONE, INDEFINITELY, CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 448.
TO PASS H.R. 448.

TO AMEND THE PROPOSED AMENDMENT TO H.R. 465, BY INSERTING "THAT NO OFFICER OF THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT, NOR ANY MEMBER OF CONGRESS, SHALL HAVE ANY LOAN OF MONEY, NOR EXTENSION OF TIME ON ANY NOTE, HERETOFORE GIVEN, FROM ANY OF SAID BANKS."

TO AMEND H.R. 465, SO AS TO OUTLINE THE RESPONSIBILITIES OF STOCKHOLDERS IN BANKS COVERED BY THIS BILL.

TO RECOMMIT S.RES. 22 TO COMMITTEE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION TO PROVIDE THAT EACH STOCKHOLDER IN SUCH BANK SHALL BE LIABLE, EACH TO THE FULL AMOUNT OF HIS STOCK IN THE BANK, FOR ALL DEBTS CONTRACTED BY THE BANK, IN THE EVENT THAT SUCH BAN SHALL REFUSE TO PAY ON DEMAND.
TO ADOPT S.RES. 22.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION S.J.RES. 18, TO AUTHORIZE THE SEC. OF THE NAVY TO PURCHASE REPEATING RIFLES AND PISTOLS FOR THE USE OF THE NAVY.

TO RECEDE FROM THE SENATE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 5 IN ORDER TO BRING THE MINDS OF BOTH HOUSES TOGETHER IN AGREEMENT ON THE BILL; SAID AMENDMENT IS TO APPROPRIATE A SUM FOR AN OUTFIT TO THE RESIDENT MINISTER AT CONSTANTINOPLE.
TO AMEND THE BILL H.R. 27, FOR THE RELIEF OF CHASTELAIN AND PONVERT, TO FURTHER AMEND THE BILL TO INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING "FOR THE PAYMENT OF CHARLES GORDON, FOR SERVICES IN MAP MAKING, $2100."

TO AMEND THE RESOLUTION THAT THE SENATE DO NOT ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY MADE WITH THE SEVERAL TRIBES OF NEW YORK INDIANS, SINCE THE AMENDMENT PROPOSED TO SAID TREATY BY THE SENATE HAS NOT BEEN ASSENTED TO BY SAID INDIANS.  THEAMENDMENT OFFERED BY SEN

TO AMEND, IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR, THE RES. CON- CERNING THE N.Y. INDIAN TREATY, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT IN THE OPINION OF THE SENATE, THE AMENDMENT PROPOSED BY A RESOLUTION OF THE SENATE TO SAID TREATY HAS BEEN ASSENTED TO BY SAID INDIANS ACCORDNG TO THE TERMS OF SAID RESOLUTION.

TO AMEND, IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR, THE RESOLUTION CONCERNING THE N.Y. INDIAN TREATY, SO AS TO PROVIDE THAT SAID TREATY BE RETURNED TO THE PRES. BECAUSE THE QUESTION WHETHER AMENDMENTS REQUIRED TO THE TREATY BY RESOLUTION OF RATIFICATION HAVE BEN ASSENTED TO BY SAID INDIANS, IS A QUESTION REFERRED TO EXCLUSIVE DECISION OF THE PRESIDENT, ON WHICH THE SENATE IS NOT CONSTITUTIONALLY REQUIRED TO ACT; BUT, WHILE THE SENATE DOES NOT FEEL CALLED UPON TO EXERCISE ITS POWER IN THE PREMISES, IT IS OF THE ...

TO AMEND, IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR, THE RESOLUTION CONCERNING THE NEW YORK INDIAN TREATY, TO PROVIDE THAT AFTER THE AMENDED TREATY WITH THE N.Y. INDIANS HAD BEEN SUBMITTED AND EXPLAINED TO EACH OF THE TRIBES, THE ASSENT THERETO GIVEN BY EACH CHIF, WAS A DUE COMPLIANCE WITH THE INTEREST AND MEANING OF THE RESOLUTION OF THE SENATE.

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE FOR THE RESOLUTION CONCERNING THE N.Y. INDIAN TREATY, TO PROVIDE THAT: IN THE OPINION OF THE SENATE, SAID RESOLUTION OUGHT NOT TO BE CONSTRUED AS TO REQUIRE THE SIGNATURES AND SEALS OF THE CHIEFS TO BEAFFIXED TO SAID AMENDMENTS IN ORDER TO MAKE THEIR ASSENT VALID

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT TO THE RESOLUTION CONCERNING THE NEW YORK INDIAN TREATY, TO PROPOSE THAT THE SENATE CONCUR THAT THE AMENDED TREATY BE RESPECTFULLY RETURNED TO THE PRESIDENT, SINCE THE SENATE IS OF THE OPINION THAT THE QUESTION WHETHER THE AMENDMEN TO THE TREATY BY THE RESOLU- TION OF RATIFICATION HAS BEEN ASSENTED TO BY SAID INDIANS, IS ONE WHICH WAS REFERRED TO THE EXCLUSIVE DECISION OF THE PRESIDENT, ON WHICH THE SENATE IS NOT CONSTITUTIONALLY RE- QUIRED TO ACT

TO AMEND, IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE TO, THE RESOLUTION CONCERNING THE N.Y. INDIAN TREATY, TO PROVIDE THAT: IN THE OPINION OF THE SENATE, THE RESOLUTION OUGHT NOT TO BE CONSTRUED AS TO REQUIRE THE SIGNATURES AND SEALS OF THE CHIEFS TO BE AFFIXED TO SAD AMENDMENT IN ORDER TO MAKE THEIR ASSENT VALID, PROVIDED IT SHALL APPEAR THAT THE AMENDMENT HAS BEEN FULLY EXPLAINED TO THEM, IN OPEN COUNCIL, AGREEABLE TO THE TRUE INTEREST AND MEANING OF SAID RESOLUTION
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION CONCERNING THE NEW YORK INDIAN TREATY.  THE VICE PRESIDENT VOTED IN THE AFFIRMATIVE.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMANT AND THIRD READING OF S. 69 (APP. 3/2/41), AWARDING A PENSION TO HANNAH LEIGHTON, WIDOW OF ISAAC DAVIS.
TO TABLE THE MOTION TO BRING IN THE BILL FOR CIRCULATION OF BANKS AND BANKERS, AND OF ALL CORPORATION'S, COMPANIES AND INDIVIDUALS WHICH ISSUE PAPER MONEY.
TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY OF COMMERCE AND NAVIGATION BETWEEN THE U.S. AND HIS MAJESTY, THE KING OF THE BELGIANS, CONCLUDED IN MARCH OF 1840.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL S. 6, TO CREATE AN ADDITIONAL LAND OFFICE IN THE STATE OF MICHIGAN AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES.

TO AMEND THE BILL S. 28, ESTABLISHING A PERMANENT PROSPECTIVE PRE-EMPTION SYSTEM IN FAVOR OF SETTLERS ON THE PUBLIC LANDS, WHO SHALL INHABIT AND CULTIVATE IT, AND RAISE A LOG CABIN THEREON, BY PROPOSING TO CONFINE THE BENEFITS OF THE BILL TO WHITE PERSON ONLY.
TO AMEND S. 28, TO CONFINE THE BENEFITS OF THE BILL TO CITIZENS OF THE U.S.

TO AGREE TO THE FIRST PART OF THE AMENDMENT TO THE AMENDMENT TO S. 28 WHICH WOULD EXTEND THE BENEFITS OF THE ACT ONLY TO CITIZENS OR THOSE WHO LEGALLY HAD MADE SUCH INTENTION TO BECOME A CITIZEN OF THE U.S.

TO AGREE TO THE SECOND PART OF THE AMENDMENT TO THE AMEND. TO S. 28, PROVIDING TO EXTEND THESE BENEFITS ONLY TO THOSE TAKING OATH THAT THEIR ESTATES WERE WORTH LESS THAN $500.00 AT THE TIME OF SETTLEMENT.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND 3RD READING OF THE BILL S. 99, TO GRANT PUBLIC LAND TO HOWARD UNIVERSITY IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO AMEND S. 28, TO PREVENT THE ACQUISITION OF A PRE-EMPTION RIGHT BY ANY PERSON WHO OWNS LAND AND QUITS IT TO LIVE ON THE PUBLIC LANDS IN THE SAME STATE OR TERRITORY.
TO ADJOURN UNTIL MONDAY NEXT, WHEN THE SENATE ADJOURNS TODAY.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION TO POSTPONE S. 28 UNTIL MONDAY NEXT.

TO AMEND S. 185, A BILL TO MAKE CERTAIN APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE PATENT OFFICE, BY ELIMINATING THE APPROPRIATION OF $1000 FOR THE COLLECTION OF AGRICULTURE STATISTICS, AND FOR OTHER AGRICULTURAL PURPOSES, AS THIS APPROPRIATION IS NOT IN COMMON WITH THE PATNT OFFICE.

TO RECOMMIT S. 28 TO COMMITTEE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO SUBSTI- TUTE A NEW SUBJECT AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE, THE SUBSTITUTE PROPOSING A CESSION OF THE PUBLIC LANDS TO THE STATES IN WHICH THEY LIE, ON CERTAIN CONDITIONS.

TO RECOMMIT S. 28 TO COMMITTEE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO REPORT AMENDS. THERETO PROVIDING TO GRANT PROCEEDS OF SALES OF PUB- LIC LANDS AMONG THE SEVERAL STATES, IN JUST PROPORTIONS; TO GRANT THE RIGHT OF PRE-EMPTION TO LAND NOT EXCEEDING 320 ACRES AT $1.25 PE ACRE, AND TO SETTLERS WHOSE ESTATE SHALL NOT EXCEED THE VALUE OF $1000, AND TO EXCLUDE SPECULATORS FROM ANY BENEFITS OF SAME.

TO AMEND S. 28, BY SUBSTITUTING A NEW BILL AFTER THE ENACT- ING CLAUSE.  THIS NEW BILL WOULD GRANT PRE-EMPTION TO THOSE WHO HAVE ALREADY SETTLED ON SUCH PUBLIC LANDS AS LONG AS THEY MEET CERTAIN REQUIREMENTS AS SET FORTH IN THE BILL.
TO PASS THE BILL H.R. 536 (APP. FEB. 2, 1841) TO MAKE TEMPORARY PROVISIONS FOR LUNATICS IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.

TO AMEND S. 28 TO CHANGE THE AGE AT WHICH A SETTLER, WHO IS HEAD OF A FAMILY, IS ELIGIBLE FOR THE BENEFITS OF THIS BILL.  THE AMENDMENT WOULD REQUIRE THAT THE PERSON MUST BE TWENTY-ONE, RATHER THAN EIGHTEEN.
TO ADJOURN; MOTION MADE DURING DEBATE ON S. 28.
TO AMEND S. 28 TO LIMIT ITS OPERATION TO TWO YEARS.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 28.
TO POSTPONE CONSIDERATION OF S. 28 IN ORDER TO HAVE A FULL VOTE OF THE SENATE ON THIS SUBJECT, SINCE THERE WERE SOME SENATORS NOW ABSENT WHO WOULD BE HERE IN A FEW DAYS.

TO RECOMMIT S. 28 TO COMMITTEE WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO SUBSTI- TUTE A NEW SUBJECT WHICH WOULD PROVIDE THAT THE SAID STATES SHALL PAY TO THE U.S. GOVT. A PERCENTAGE OF THE REVENUE FROM SALE OF SAID LAND, AND THAT THE PRICE OF SAID LAND SHALL BE REDUCED IN PRSCRIBED STEPS ON CERTAIN DATES UNTIL ALL UNSOLD LAND SHALL BE CEDED TO THE STATE WHEREIN THE LAND LIES.

TO RECOMMIT S. 28 TO COMM. WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO SUBSTITUTE A NEW SUBJECT PROVIDING TO GRANT PROCEEDS OF SALES OF PUBLIC LANDS EQUALLY AMONG THE STATES GIVING RIGHT OF PRE-EMPTION OF LAND NOT EXCEEDING 320 ACRES AT $1.25 AN ACRE TO PERSONS WORTH NOT MORE HAN $1000 AND EXCLUDING SPECULATORS FROM THE BENEFITS OF THE ACT.
TO PASS S. 28.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY OF COMMERCE AND NAVIGATION BETWEEN THE U.S. AND HER MAJESTY, THE QUEEN OF PORTUGAL AND OF THE ALGAVES, CONCLUDED IN AUGUST OF 1840.

TO AMEND S. 160, A BILL TO ESTABLISH A UNIFORM SYSTEM OF BANKRUPTCY, BY PROVIDING THAT A BANKRUPT CAN BE DISCHARGED ONLY BY A CERTIFICATE SIGNED BY 2/3 OF THE CREDITORS, RATHER THAN BY ACT OF A JUDGE WITHOUT CONSENT OF THE CREDITORS.
TO CONSIDER THE BILL S. 92, TO REVIVE AND CONTINUE THE EXISTENCE OF THE BANKS IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA.
TO RECOMMIT S. 160.
TO ORDER A THIRD READING OF THE BILL H.R. 598, TO AUTHORIZE THE ISSUE OF TREASURY NOTES.
TO PASS THE BILL H.R. 598, TO AUTHORIZE THE ISSUING OF TREASURY NOTES.

TO AMEND THE BILL H.R. 529 (APP. FEB. 18, 1841, 5 STATL L 412), TO MAKE APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE PAYMENT OF REVOLUTIONARY AND OTHER PENSIONERS OF THE U.S., BY ELIMINATING THE APPROPRIATION OF $100,000 FOR THE SETTLE- MENT AND TRANSPORTATION OF THE SEMINOLEINDIANS.

TO PASS THE BILL H.R. 607 (APP. FEB. 18, 1841), TO AUTHORIZE THE STATE OF TENNESSEE TO ISSUE GRANTS AND PERFECT TITLES TO CERTAIN LANDS DESCRIBED IN THE BILL, AND TO SETTLE CLAIMS TO VACANT AND UNAPPROPRIATED LANDS WITHIN THE SAME.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION TO ADMIT LADIES TO PRIVILEGED SEATS ON THE FLOOR OF THE SENATE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PRESENT SESSION.
TO POSTPONE UNTIL MARCH 4 THE ELECTION OF A PRINTER TO THE SENATE, IN AN ATTEMPT TO HAVE A DIFFERENT PRINTER APPOINTED.
TO TAKE UP THE RESOLUTION TO REPEAL "THE ACT FOR THE COLLECTION, SAFEKEEPING, TRANSFER AND DISBURSEMENT OF THE PUBLIC REVENUE."
TO PROVIDE THAT WHEN THE SENATE ADJOURNS TODAY, IT DO SO UNTIL TERMINATION OF THE SESSION.
TO CONSIDER THE RESOLUTION TO ADMIT LADIES TO THE PRIVILEGED SEATS ON THE FLOOR OF THE SENATE.
TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION TO REPEAL THE "ACT FOR THE COLLECTION, SAFEKEEPING, TRANSFER, AND DISBURSEMENT OF THE PUBLIC REVENUE."
TO GRANT PERMISSION TO INTRODUCE THE BILL S. 262, TO PREVENT THE INTERFERENCE OF CERTAIN FEDERAL OFFICERS IN ELECTIONS.

TO AMEND S. 92 FOR THE PURPOSE OF SUBSTITUTING A NEW SUBJECT AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE.  THIS NEW SUBJECT LISTS CERTAIN RESTRICTIONS ON ISSUANCE OF BANK NOTES AND LISTS OTHER RESTRICTIONS AND PERMISSIONS RELATING TO THE OPERATION OF THESE BANKS.
TO AMEND S. 92 TO PROVIDE THAT NOTHING IN THE BILL IS TO BE SO CONSTRUCTED AS TO PREVENT SAID BANKS FROM PAYING DEPOSITS PREVIOUSLY MADE, OR IN THE KIND OF FUNDS IN WHICH SAID DEPOSITS WERE MADE.
TO AMEND S. 92 TO MAKE OFFICERS AND STOCKHOLDERS LIABLE FOR THE DEBTS OF THE BANK IN WHICH THEY HAVE INTEREST.
TO AMEND S. 92 TO SPECIFICALLY OUTLINE THE CONDITIONS OF LIABILITY OF STOCKHOLDERS AND OFFICERS IN SAID BANKS.
TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF S. 92.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF THE TREATY OF NOVEMBER 28, 1840 BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE MIAMI TRIBE OF INDIANS, WITH AMENDMENT TO INCREASE THE APPROPRIATIONS FOR PAYMENTS OF DEBTS; TO CONVEY TEN SQUARE MILES TO THE BAND OF ME-T-SIUIA, TO BE HELD IN TRUST BY SAID BAND; AND TO ASSIGN 500,000 ACRES TO THE MIAMIS FOR OCCUPANCY.
TO TABLE THE NOMINATION OF JOHN L. SIBLEY AS U.S. MARSHALL FOR THE DISTRICT OF MASSACHUSETTS FROM MARCH 3, 1841, WHEN HIS PRESENT COMMISSION WILL EXPIRE.

TO AMEND, IN THE NATURE OF A SUBSTITUTE, THE BILL S. 162 WHICH IS THE ACT ENTITLED "AN ACT SUPPLEMENTARY TO THE ACT ENTITLED AN ACT TO AMEND THE JUDICIAL SYSTEM OF THE U.S." THE SUBSTITUTE SPECIFIES THE BOUNDARIES OF THE THIRD THROUGH THE NINTH CIRCUITS.
TO PROVIDE THAT WHEN THE SENATE ADJOURNS TODAY, IT DO SO UNTIL TERMINATION OF THE SESSION, IN ORDER TO PREVENT AN EVENING SESSION.
TO TABLE THE NOMINATION OF PETER V. DANIEL AS ASSOCIATE JUSTICE OF THE SUPREME COURT.
TO REFER THE NOMINATION OF PETER V. DANIEL TO BE ASSOCIATE JUSTICE OF THE SUPREME COURT, TO THE COMMITTEE ON THE JUDICIARY.
TO CONCUR IN THE APPOINTMENT AND NOMINATION OF PETER V. DANIEL AS ASSOCIATE JUSTICE OF THE SUPREME COURT.

TO TABLE THE RESOLUTION TO PRINT, FOR THE USE OF THE SENATE, THE MEMORIAL PRESENTED BY THE PEOPLE CALLED MORMONS, TOGETHER WITH THE AFFIDAVITS AND DOCUMENTS RELATED TO THE TRIAL OF JOSEPH SMITH, JR. IN THE STATE OF MISSOURI.
TO AMEND THE BILL H.R. 601 (APP. MAR. 15, 1841, 0) TO MAKE APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE CIVIL AND DIPLOMATIC EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT TO 1841.

TO AMEND THE BILL, H.R. 601 (APP. MAR. 15, 1841, 0), TO MAKE APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE CIVIL AND DIPLOMATIC EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT, BY PROPOSING TO CONFINE THE BENEFITS OF THIE BILL AND TO LIMIT REMUNERATION OF CUSTOMS COLLECTORS, NAVAL OFFICERS AND SUREYORS TO A CERTAIN SUM

TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 544 TO APPROPRIATE A SUM TO SET UP TWO LIFE-BOAT STATIONS ON THE EAST COAST.
TO AMEND H.R. 580, A BILL TO MAKE APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE ARMY FOR THE YEAR 1841, BY APPROPRIATING A CERTAIN SUM IN ORDER TO COMPLETE CERTAIN MILITARY ROADS.
TO AMEND THE BILL H.R. 580, TO MAKE APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE ARMY FOR THE YEAR 1841 SO AS TO APPROPRIATE A SUM TO REMOVE THE RAFT OF RED RIVER.

TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL, H.R. 543, TO MAKE APPROPRIATIONS FOR THE CURRENT EXPENSES OF THE INDIAN DEPARTMENT, AND TO FULFILL TREATY STIPULATIONS WITH THE VARIOUS INDIAN TRIBES FOR THE YEAR 1841, FOR THE PUPOSE OF OPENING THE SUBJECT FOR FURTHER CONSIDERATION.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE TO CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 543 WHICH PROPOSED CERTAIN SUMS BE APPROPRIATED TO DEFRAY THE EXPENSES OF HOLDING TREATIES WITH THE WYANDOT, FOX, WINNEBAGO AND SAC INDIANS.
TO TABLE THE NOMINATION OF FRANCIS PRICE AS ASSISTANT COLLECTOR OF CUSTOMS FOR THE DISTRICT OF NEW YORK TO RESIDE AT JERSEY CITY, NEW JERSEY.

TO ADOPT THE RESOLUTION TO APPROPRIATE A CERTAIN SUM TO COMPENSATE SENATE EMPLOYEES FOR EXTRA SERVICES.
TO RECONSIDER THE VOTE TO ORDER ENGROSSMENT AND THIRD READING OF THE BILL H.R. 539, CONCERNING NAVY PENSIONS AND HALF PAY.
TO PASS THE BILL H.R. 76, TO INCORPORATE THE WASHINGTON CITY BENEVOLENT SOCIETY.
TO GO INTO EXECUTIVE SESSION.

TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT TO S. 36, A BILL TO PROVIDE FOR THE SETTLEMENT OF THE CLAIMS OF THE STATE OF MAINE FOR THE SERVICES OF HER MILITIA.  SAID AMENDMENT TO THE AMEND- MENT WOULD APPROPRIATE A SUM TO SETTLE THE CLAIMS OF BOTH THE STATES OF GEORGIA AND AABAMA FOR MILITIA EXPENSES.
TO AMEND THE AMENDMENT TO S. 36 SO AS TO APPROPRIATE A SUM TO PAY THE CLAIM OF THE STATE OF NEW HAMPSHIRE FOR THE SERVICES OF HER MILITIA.
TO AMEND S. 36 TO APPROPRIATE A SUM TO THE STATE OF GEORGIA TO MEET THE EXPENSES OF THE MILITIA IN HANDLING PAST AND FUTURE INDIAN UPRISINGS.
